entry.title: Hello World
entry.content:
Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.

Quick Start

a sunny day

Create a new post

$ hexo new "My New Post"

More info: Writing

Run server

$ hexo server

More info: Server

Generate static files

$ hexo generate

More info: Generating

Deploy to remote sites

$ hexo deploy

More info: Deployment

# useful only for Mac OS Silicon M1, # still working but useless for the other platformsdocker() { if [[ `uname -m` == "arm64" ]] && [[ "$1" == "run" || "$1" == "build" ]]; then    /usr/local/bin/docker "$1" --platform linux/amd64 "${@:2}"  else     /usr/local/bin/docker "$@"  fi}

entry.title: è®ºæ–‡é˜…è¯»ã€ŠSelf-Tuning PID Control via a Hybrid Actor-Critic-Based Neural Structure for Quadcopter Controlã€‹
entry.content: online method for tracking disturbance and fast training: A model-free actor-critic-based hybrid neural structure was used that was able to properly tune PID gains, and also has done the best as an identifier. In both tunning and identification tasks, a Neural Network with two hidden layers and sigmoid activation functions has been learned using Adaptive Momentum(ADAM) optimizer and Back-Propagation(BP) algorithm.

entry.title: learning pyspark
entry.content:
å¸¸è¯»å¸¸æ–°

tricks

case 1

from pyspark.sql import SparkSessionfrom pyspark.sql import functions as Ffrom pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, FloatTypespark = SparkSession.builder.appName("DynamicIntervalColumn").getOrCreate()schema = StructType([StructField("value", FloatType(), True)])  # True è¡¨ç¤ºå…è®¸ç©ºå€¼data = [(13.,), (0.2,), (3.,), (40.,), (5.,), (6.,), (10.,), (20.,)]df = spark.createDataFrame(data, schema=schema)df.printSchema()# ç»™å®šçš„åŒºé—´åˆ—è¡¨interval_list = [0, 1, 3, 5, 10, 20, 999]interval_col_list = []for i in range(len(interval_list)-1):    condition = (F.col("value") >= interval_list[i]) & (F.col("value") < interval_list[i+1])    col_name = f"({interval_list[i]},{interval_list[i+1]})"    interval_col_list.append(col_name)    df = df.withColumn(col_name, F.when(condition, 1).otherwise(0))interval_conditions = [{"interval": col, "column": col} for col in interval_col_list]df = df.withColumn("interval", F.lit(""))for condition in interval_conditions:    interval = condition["interval"]    column = condition["column"]    df = df.withColumn("interval", F.when(F.col(column) == 1, interval).otherwise(F.col("interval")))df.show()

entry.title: æ·±åº¦å­¦ä¹ æ¡†æ¶ï¼šPyTorchã€TensorFlowã€Kerasã€Gluonç­‰
entry.content:
æ­ç§¯æœ¨ï¼Œæˆä¸ºç§¯æœ¨å¤§ç¥ã€‚

Deep learning (DL) frameworks offer building blocks for designing, training, and validating deep neural networks through a high-level programming interface. Widely-used DL frameworks, such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, PyTorch Geometric, DGL, and others, rely on GPU-accelerated libraries, such as cuDNN, NCCL, and DALI to deliver high-performance, multi-GPU-accelerated training.

package datastructure.linear;public class SwapLetters {    public static void main(String[] args) {        String inputString = "DaFBcAz";        char[] charArray = inputString.toCharArray();        swapLetters(charArray);        System.out.println(charArray);    }    public static void swapLetters(char[] charArray) {        int i = 0;        int j = charArray.length - 1;        while (i < j) {            // find uppercase letter using pointer i            while (i < charArray.length && !Character.isUpperCase(charArray[i])) {                i++;            }            // find lowercase letter using pointer j            while (j >= 0 && !Character.isLowerCase(charArray[j])) {                j--;            }            // swap            if (i < j) {                char tmp = charArray[i];                charArray[i] = charArray[j];                charArray[j] = tmp;                i++;                j--;            }        }    }}

      import random   import numpy as np     class BernoulliBandit:       """æ‹‰æ†æ•°ä¸ºkçš„å¤šè‡‚è€è™æœºï¼š       1.æ‹‰åŠ¨æ¯æ ¹æ‹‰æ†çš„å¥–åŠ±æœä»ä¼¯åŠªåˆ©åˆ†å¸ƒï¼ˆBernoulli distributionï¼‰       2.æ¯æ¬¡æ‹‰ä¸‹æ‹‰æ†æœ‰pçš„æ¦‚ç‡è·å¾—çš„å¥–åŠ±ä¸º1ï¼Œæœ‰1-pçš„æ¦‚ç‡è·å¾—çš„å¥–åŠ±ä¸º0       3.å¥–åŠ±ä¸º1ä»£è¡¨è·å¥–ï¼Œå¥–åŠ±ä¸º0ä»£è¡¨æ²¡æœ‰è·å¥–       """       def __init__(self, k):           self.k = k           self.probs = np.random.uniform(size=k)           self.best_idx = np.argmax(self.probs)           self.best_probs = self.probs[self.best_idx]       def step(self, k):           if np.random.rand() < self.probs[k]:               # print(f"æ‹‰åŠ¨{k}å·ä½èµŒåšæœºï¼Œä¸­å¥–")               return 1           else:               # print(f"æ‹‰åŠ¨{k}å·ä½èµŒåšæœºï¼Œæ²¡æœ‰ä¸­å¥–")               return 0       def print_prob(self):           for i in range(self.k):               res = self.step(i)               print(f"{i}å·æ‹‰æ†åï¼šè·å¥–={res}ï¼Œè·å¥–æ¦‚ç‡ä¸º{self.probs[i]}")   if __name__ == '__main__':       np.random.seed(1)       arms = 10       arm = random.randint(0, arms-1)       bandits_10_arm = BernoulliBandit(arms)       bandits_10_arm.step(k=arm)       print(f"éšæœºç”Ÿæˆäº†{arms}è‡‚ä¼¯åŠªåˆ©è€è™æœº")       print(f"è·å¥–æ¦‚ç‡æœ€å¤§çš„æ‹‰æ†ä¸º{bandits_10_arm.best_idx}ï¼Œå…¶è·å¥–æ¦‚ç‡ä¸º{bandits_10_arm.best_probs}")       bandits_10_arm.print_prob()                                                  # import numpy as npP = np.array([[0.2, 0.3, 0.5],              [0.1, 0.6, 0.3],              [0.4, 0.5, 0.1]])s = np.array([[0.6, 0.2, 0.2]])def print_n_state(n, s):    i = 1    while i < n:        print(f"Step {i}: {s}")        s = np.matmul(P.T, s.T).T        i = i + 1        print_n_state(5, s)

Python æ–¹æ³•ï¼Œå¯¹ç»™å®šçš„é©¬å°”å¯å¤«é“¾è¿›è¡Œè¿ç®—ï¼Œç›´åˆ°è¾¾åˆ°ç‰¹å®šçš„æ—¶é—´æ­¥æˆ–ç¨³æ€ã€‚

import numpy as npdef run_markov_chain(transition_matrix, n=10, print_transitions=False):    step = transition_matrix    for time_step in range(1, n):        if print_transitions:            # print(n)            print("transition matrix at step: " + str(time_step))            print(step)            print("-------------------------")        next_step = np.matmul(step, transition_matrix).round(2)        print(next_step)        if np.array_equal(step, next_step):            print("markov chain reached steady-state at time-step = " + str(time_step))            if not print_transitions:                print(step)            return step        else:            step = next_steptransition_matrix = np.array([[0.2, 0.3, 0.5],                              [0.1, 0.6, 0.3],                              [0.4, 0.5, 0.1]])run_markov_chain(transition_matrix, print_transitions=True)

åªæœ‰æ­£åˆ™é©¬å°”å¯å¤«é“¾ä¼šéšç€æ—¶é—´çš„æ¨ç§»æ”¶æ•›ã€‚å¦‚æœä½ çš„é©¬å°”å¯å¤«é“¾ä¸æ”¶æ•›ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆå®ƒå…·æœ‰å‘¨æœŸæ€§æ¨¡å¼ã€‚

åœ¨å…·æœ‰å‘¨æœŸæ€§çš„é©¬å°”å¯å¤«é“¾ä¸­ï¼Œä¸æœ€ç»ˆä»¥ç»™å®šçŠ¶æ€ç»“æŸçš„å¯èƒ½æ€§è¾¾åˆ°ç¨³æ€å€¼ä¸åŒï¼Œä½ ä¼šä»æ—¶é—´åˆ°æ—¶é—´è·å¾—ç›¸åŒçš„è½¬ç§»æ¦‚ç‡ã€‚

ä¸€ä¸ªéšæœºè¿‡ç¨‹çš„æœªæ¥çŠ¶æ€çš„æ¡ä»¶æ¦‚ç‡åˆ†å¸ƒåªä¾èµ–äºå½“å‰çŠ¶æ€ï¼Œä¸è¿‡å»çŠ¶æ€æ˜¯æ¡ä»¶ç‹¬ç«‹çš„ï¼Œåˆ™è¯¥éšæœºè¿‡ç¨‹å…·æœ‰é©¬å°”å¯å¤«æ€§è´¨ã€‚

ä½†æœ‰æ—¶å€™è®¤ä¸ºå®ƒæ˜¯å…·æœ‰é©¬å°”å¯å¤«æ€§è´¨ä¸”å­˜åœ¨äºç¦»æ•£çš„æŒ‡æ•°é›†å’ŒçŠ¶æ€ç©ºé—´å†…çš„éšæœºè¿‡ç¨‹ï¼Œè€Œè®¤ä¸ºé©¬å°”å¯å¤«è¿‡ç¨‹ä¸ºé€‚ç”¨äºè¿ç»­æŒ‡æ•°é›†çš„é©¬å°”å¯å¤«é“¾ã€‚

å¯¹äºé©¬å°”å¯å¤«é“¾å’Œé©¬å°”å¯å¤«è¿‡ç¨‹çš„æ¦‚å¿µä¸ç”¨è¿‡äºåŒºåˆ†ï¼Œè§†ä½œä¸€æ ·çš„å«ä¹‰å³å¯ã€‚

ç”¨å…ƒç»„$<S,P>$è¡¨ç¤ºï¼Œå…¶ä¸­$S$æ˜¯æœ‰é™æ•°é‡çš„çŠ¶æ€é›†ï¼Œ$P$æ˜¯çŠ¶æ€è½¬ç§»æ¦‚ç‡çŸ©é˜µ(n x né˜¶)ã€‚çŠ¶æ€è½¬ç§»çŸ©é˜µæ˜¯ä¸ºäº†æè¿°ä¸€ä¸ªçŠ¶æ€åˆ°å¦ä¸€ä¸ªçŠ¶æ€å‘ç”Ÿçš„æ¦‚ç‡ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥çŸ©é˜µæ¯è¡Œå…ƒç´ ä¹‹å’Œä¸º1ã€‚

é©¬å°”å¯å¤«å›æŠ¥è¿‡ç¨‹

$MRP$å°±æ˜¯å¸¦æœ‰ä»·å€¼çš„é©¬å°”å¯å¤«é“¾ï¼Œä»¥å…ƒç»„$<S,P,R,\gamma>$è¡¨ç¤ºï¼Œå…¶ä¸­æ˜¯$R$å›æŠ¥ã€$\gamma$æ˜¯è¡°å‡ç‡ã€‚

é©¬å°”å¯å¤«å†³ç­–è¿‡ç¨‹

ä»¥å…ƒç»„$<S,A,P,R,\gamma>$è¡¨ç¤ºï¼Œå…¶ä¸­$A$æ˜¯çŠ¶æ€$S$ä¸‹çš„æœ‰é™æ•°é‡çš„åŠ¨ä½œé›†ã€‚

$P(sâ€™|s,a)$è¡¨ç¤ºåœ¨çŠ¶æ€$s$ä¸‹æ‰§è¡ŒåŠ¨ä½œ$a$åè½¬ç§»åˆ°çŠ¶æ€$sâ€™$çš„æ¦‚ç‡ã€‚
$$
P^a_{ssâ€™}=P(S_{t+1}=sâ€™|S_t=s,A_t=a)
$$

$R(sâ€™|s,a)$è¡¨ç¤ºåœ¨çŠ¶æ€$s$ä¸‹æ‰§è¡ŒåŠ¨ä½œ$a$åè½¬ç§»åˆ°çŠ¶æ€$sâ€™$çš„å›æŠ¥ã€‚
$$
R^a_{ssâ€™}=E(R_{t+1}=sâ€™|S_t=s,A_t=a,S_{t+1}=sâ€™)
$$

çŠ¶æ€ä»·å€¼å‡½æ•°

$$
V_{\pi}(s) = E(G_t|S_t=s) = \sum_{a\in A}\pi(a|s)Q_\pi(s,a) = \sum\pi(a|s)\sum_{sâ€™}P^a_{ssâ€™}[R^a_{ssâ€™}+\gamma V_{\pi}(sâ€™)]
$$

  • ä»·å€¼å‡½æ•°
  • çŠ¶æ€ä»·å€¼æ˜¯åœ¨å½“å‰çŠ¶æ€$s$æ‰€æœ‰å¯èƒ½é‡‡å–çš„åŠ¨ä½œ$a$å¾—åˆ°çš„åŠ¨ä½œä»·å€¼çš„æœŸæœ›
  • å½“å‰çŠ¶æ€$s$çš„ä»·å€¼$V_{\pi}(s)$ä¸ä¸‹ä¸€ä¸ªçŠ¶æ€$sâ€™$çš„ä»·å€¼$V_{\pi}(sâ€™)$ä¹‹é—´çš„é€’å½’å…³ç³»

åŠ¨ä½œä»·å€¼å‡½æ•°

$$
Q_{\pi}(s) = E(G_t|S_t=s, A_t=a) = \sum_{sâ€™}P^a_{ssâ€™}[R^a_{ssâ€™}+\gamma V_{\pi}(sâ€™)] = \sum_{sâ€™}P^a_{ssâ€™}[R^a_{ssâ€™}+\gamma\sum_{sâ€™,aâ€™}\pi(aâ€™|sâ€™)Q(sâ€™,aâ€™)]

import gymimport loggingimport warningswarnings.filterwarnings('ignore')logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO,format='%(asctime)s - %(filename)s[line:%(lineno)d] - %(levelname)s: %(message)s')env = gym.make("HumanoidStandup-v4")action = env.action_spacedone = Falsescore = 0state = env.reset()while not done:    env.render()    action = env.action_space.sample()    observation, reward, done, info = env.step(action)    logging.info(f"done: {done} total score: {score}")    score += rewardlogging.info(f"done: {done} total score: {score}")

entry.title: ã€01ã€‘å¯å‘å¼ç®—æ³•é˜…è¯»ç¬”è®°ï¼šPath relinking for the routing problem
entry.content:
A tabu search heuristic with path relinking for the vehicle routing problem. Tabu search is a local search method that explores the solution sapce more thoroughly than other local search based methods by overcoming local optima. Path relinking is a method to integrate intensification and diversification in the search.

Paper: Path relinking for the vehicle routing problem

Code: code reference

Vehicle Routing

Tabu search

Path relinking
